|brand = D-Link |model = DIR-615 |submodelappend = <!-- yes, for space --> |submodel = <!-- SubModel number, Leave blank for unknown --> |revision = A1 |subrevision = <!-- Model Subrevision, Leave blank for none or unknown --> |model_part_num = |page_start_date = |page_start_origon = |wlclass = N300 |series = DIR-615 |type = wireless router |sernum = <!-- First 4 or so for easy version identification --> |fcc_id = KA2DIR615A1 |icid = 4216A-IR615 |us_id = <!-- US ID number --> |boardid = <!-- Board Identification, Leave blank for none --> |ecc_id = <!-- eec-id -->
|cpu1chip1 = Marvell;88F5180NB1;M, 88F5-BBR1, QH09851.0, 0623 B1E, TW, 88F180NB1, C500; |cpu1_cores = 1 |cpu1_type = ARMv5TEJ |cpu1_type_rev = <!-- CPU1 type Revision, Leave blank for unknown --> |cpu1spd = 500 <!-- undocumented --> |is_doc = |bus = <!-- 8-bit, 16-bit, 32-bit, 64-bit, Leave blank for none -->
|flash1type = <!-- Parallel,Serial(SPI),NAND,Compact Flash --> |fla1_num = <!-- 1,2,3,4 --> |fla1chip = Intel;JS28F640J3D75; |flash1size = 8 |flash1maxsize = <!-- Maximum size firmware can be in bytes -->
|ram1type = <!-- DDR,DDR2,DDR3,DDR4 --> |ram1type1 = <!-- SO-DIMM,SDRAM --> |ram1spd = <!-- RAM speed --> |ram1size = 32 |ram1chip = PSC;A2S28D40CTP-G5; |ram1_num = 2 |nvramsize = <!-- 32, 60, 64, etc... in kb, Leave blank for unknown -->
|eth_cpu = true |sw1chip = Marvell;88E6061;88E6061-LAJ1, B56973.1, 0647 A1P, TW; |wan_ports = 1 |wan_speed = <!-- 10MbE,100MbE,1GbE, --> |lan_ports = 4 |lan_speed = 100MbE |ethstandard = <!-- auto --> |portbasedvlan = <!-- Support for port based vlan tagging, Leave blank for unknown --> |802.1qvlan = <!-- Support for 802.1q vlan tagging, Leave blank for unknown --> |auto_mdix = <!-- mdix support --> |sup_jumbo = <!-- Jumbo frames support --> |ethoui = 00:1B:11, 00:1C:F0, 00:1E:58 |oui = 00:1B:11, 00:1C:F0, 00:1E:58
|bootwait = <!-- On or Off, Leave blank for unknown --> |stockbootloader = U-Boot;1.1.1;vendor modified; |stockos = Linux;2.4.27;-vrs1;
|exp_if_types = Mini PCI |exp_minipci_num = 1
|pwr_volt_type = VDC |pwr_vdc = 5 |pwr_amp_dc = 3 |pwr_conn = barrel |pwr_barrel_outer = 5.5 |pwr_barrel_inner = 2.2 |pwr_barrel_len = 10 |pwr_pol = <!-- Connector polarity -->
|serial = yes,, internal,, 4-pin header,,, (115200 8N1),, unpopulated,, 3.3V TTL |jtag = <!-- Full JTAG info -->
|specialfeat = <!-- Features that don't fit any place else, Leave blank for none --> |flags = boot log |addchip = <!-- Additional Chips --> |802dot11_protocols = bgn
|defaulip = 192.168.0.1 |defaultlogin = admin |defaultpass = <!-- default Password, Leave blank for unknown --> |defaultssid = dlink,MarvellAP8x |defaultssid_regex = ^dlink$,,,^MarvellAP8x$ |default_ch = <!-- Defaults channel(s) Radio(s) are set to --> |manuf = Cameo |manuf_model = <!-- Manufacturer Model --> |manuf_rev = <!-- Manufacturer Revision --> |is_manuf = No |tpfirmware = <!-- Third party firmware official support, AsusWRT-Merlin, CeroWrt, DD-WRT, DD-WRT (kong), DD-WRT (kongac), DD-WRT (kongarm), FreedomBox, FreshTomato-ARM, Gargoyle, LibreWrt, Oleg (wl500g), Oleg-ng (wl500g), OpenWrt, Tomato, Tomato RAF, Tomato (shibby), Tomato (Toastman), TomatoUSB, Wive-NG -->
|availability = common |eoldate = <!-- End of Life date --> |fccapprovdate = 02/14/2007 |estreldate = <!-- Estimated release date --> |estprice = <!-- Estimated retail price in US dollars --> |upc = <!-- UPC number --> |ean = <!-- EAN number --> |dx_sku = <!-- DealExtreme sku --> |newegg = <!-- newegg item number --> |asin = <!-- ASIN number --> |asin_country = <!-- ASIN country --> |asin2 = <!-- ASIN number --> |asin_country2 = <!-- ASIN country --> |countrymanuf = China
|buttons = <!-- buttons available --> |led = <!-- Led colors and descriptions --> |dimensions = <!-- Size of device {{convert |length|x|widthordepth|x|height|in|mm}} --> |weight = <!-- Weight of device {{convert|weight|oz|g}} -->
|wi1_if_name = |rad1mod = Cameo WLN-1307 |rad1modif = Mini PCI |rad1chip1 = Marvell;88W8361P;88W8361P-BEM1, FN52871.2, 0620 A3P, TW; |rad1chip2 = Marvell;88W8060; |rad1oui = <!-- Only if different from above OUI --> |rad1_ant_conn = U.FL,RP-SMA |rad1txchains = 2 |rad1rxchains = 3 |rad1sstreams = 2 |rad1stand = IEEE 802.11b/g/n |rad1n = 300 |rad1g = 54 |rad1b = 11 |rad1freq = 2.4
}}{{TIDTOC|embedded}} ==Overview== "21514DR635B11A1" and "DIR-635B1 VER:A1" is silkscreened on the board.
The wireless module has PCI ID: 11ab:2a02 (07d1:3b02). {{see also|D-Link DIR-615 series}}
===Blogs=== See also Warner's Random Hacking Blog [http://bsdimp.blogspot.com/2008/03/d-link-dir-615.html here] and [http://bsdimp.blogspot.com/2008/06/adding-serial-port-to-d-link-dir-615.html here] (boot log, there is a serial port under the internal antenna).
This board has been assigned ARM Linux Board ID# [http://www.arm.linux.org.uk/developer/machines/list.php?id=4262 4262].
To recover a soft-bricked unit without use of the serial console.. :Under Linux, curl -0F files=@dir615_firmware_110.bin http://192.168.0.1/cgi/index
When booting, the AP assumes the SSID of '''MarvellAP8x'''. The default SSID is '''dlink'''.
==Links of Interest== [http://wiki.openwrt.org/toh/d-link/dir-615 DIR-615 series on the OpenWrt wiki]
==JTAG-Serial Info== ===Serial=== ====Serial Pinouts==== The pinout for the serial connection is labelled on the board's silkscreen.
{{/Serial info}}
